doc.after: Trinidad and Tobago are southeasterly islands of the Antilles, situated between 10Â° 2' and 11Â° 12' N latitude and 60Â° 30' and 61Â° 56' W longitude. At the closest point, Trinidad is just 11 kilometres (6.8Â mi) off the Venezuelan coast. Covering an area of 5,128Â km2 (1,980Â sqÂ mi),[15] the country consists of the two main islands, Trinidad and Tobago, and numerous smaller landforms â including Chacachacare, Monos, Huevos, Gaspar Grande (or Gasparee), Little Tobago, and St. Giles Island.
